title: 471. Mayor Pete and Elaine Chao Hit the Road
description: While other countries seem to build spectacular bridges, dams, and even entire cities with ease, the U.S. is stuck in pothole-fixing mode. We speak with an array of transportation nerds — including the secretary of transportation and his immediate predecessor — to see if a massive federal infrastructure package can put America back in the driver’s seat.
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
